DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Extracted DNA Quantity Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number that represents the amount of the normal control sample measured in micrograms.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Extracted DNA
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another._A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance._A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

Concepts.definition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.:A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
